article_text:
With “America Ascendant,” the widely respected Democratic pollster Stanley Greenberg has written an ambitious book, part history, part social analysis, part campaign memo. Along the way, he provides an interesting diagnosis of America’s ills. But his policy prescriptions, like those of politicians of both parties, don’t seem capable of achieving a cure.

Mr. Greenberg believes that “America’s path is to a unified, multicultural identity,” but he is not exactly keen on bringing us together. Like most political practitioners,...

twitter.description: Michael Barone reviews “America Ascendant: A Revolutionary Nation’s Path to Addressing Its Deepest Problems and Leading the 21st Century” by Stanley B. Greenberg.
twitter.title: Painting America Blue

image.alt: Michael Barone on the future of the GOP
